item.title: The Real Cost of Minimum Payments (With Math)
item.description:
When I opened my first credit card at 22, the $150 minimum payment on my $3,000 balance felt like adulting success. Five years later, I’d thrown $1,800 at interest while still owing $2,600. This wasn’t buyer’s remorse - it was financial calculus working against me. Let’s pull back the curtain on how minimum payments keep you trapped, with real math and actionable solutions.

The Deceptive Math Behind Minimum Payments
